```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
library(gapminder)
```

## Plotly

Plotly does a good job of making any ggplot2 graphic into an interactive one through Javascript. Here's a quick example.

```{r plotly_pressure}
p <- ggplot(pressure, aes(x = temperature, y = pressure)) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_bw()
ggplotly(p)
```

## A Gapminder Example

```{r gapminder}
p <- gapminder %>%
  filter(year==1977) %>%
  select(`GDP per Capita` = gdpPercap,
         `Life Expectancy` = lifeExp,
         Population = pop,
         Continent = continent) %>% 
  ggplot( aes(x = `GDP per Capita`, 
              y = `Life Expectancy`, 
              size = Population, 
              color=Continent)) +
  geom_point() +
  scale_x_log10() +
  theme_bw()
 
ggplotly(p)
```
